intro: Pedicularis semibarbata, commonly known as the semi-barbed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are usually reddish or purple, with a distinctive hooded shape that resembles a louse, hence its common name. It is characterized by its erect stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
